topic.title: REST API
topic.shortdesc: REST API commands for managing of the X.509 certificates.

body.section:
GET/pools/default/certificate
DescriptionThis command returns the current cluster CA. If you include the parameter extended=true, it returns the extended certificate information: {"cert": {"type" : ..., "pem" : ..., "subject" : ..., "expires" : ...}, warnings: []}
Parameters
type - generated or uploaded
pem - pem encoded certificate
subject - abbreviated certificate subject (*)
expires - expiration data (*)
warnings - warnings to be displayed in UI
(*) not available for generated certificates

POST/controller/uploadClusterCA
DescriptionThis command uploads a pem-encoded root certificate (cluster CA) to the cluster. That certificate will be displayed in the UI and used for XDCR replications and for client certificate stores.
Example curl -X POST --data-binary "@/path/root.pem" http://user:password@127.0.0.1:9000/controller/uploadClusterCA
Returns
Same output as GET/pools/default/certificate?extended=true

section.title: POST /node/controller/reloadCertificate
section.p: This command grabs chain.pem and pkey.pem from the data folder/inbox/ directory and applies them to the node.

ul.li: chain.pem - Contains a chain of pem-encoded certificates starting from the node certificate and ending with the last intermediate certificate that precedes the cluster certificate.
pkey.pem - Contains the pem-encoded private key for the node certificate.
400 - An error message if it failed.

section.title: GET /pools/default/certificate/node/<host:port>
section.p: This command retrieves information about the uploaded node certificate.
